intro: Ditassa pedunculata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in warm, humid environments. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are pollinated by insects. The leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native arid habitats.
